Issues.Title: Compiler not allowing property named 'default'
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package "@angular/compiler-cli": "~8.2.3", ### Description When I try to use a function to create a model, it has an irrelevant error populating because the property is called 'default'. If you change the name to 'isDefault' this error does not show up. So, this error "':' expected." is preventing me from creating a model with a property named default. You are allowed to declare a model with property named 'default', no errors involved. But as soon as you try to use that property in a function it provides an error. If this is intended behavior then why would the compiler allow a model with a property named 'default'? ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-issue-repro2-3mcvxr?file=src/app/app.component.ts ## üî• Exception or Error

Issues.Title: "validate-commit-message" lint check should only verify commits that belong to a given PR
Issues.Body: Currently the "validate-commit-message" lint check for PRs verify all commits from v9.0.x to HEAD (which is ~850 commits atm). Instead, the "validate-commit-message" lint check should only verify messages for commits that belong to a given PR.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue ""validate-commit-message" lint check should only verify commits that belong to a given PR " (#35021)

Issues.Title: Do not run "validate-commit-message" lint check for upstream branches
Issues.Body: Currently the `validate-commit-message` lint check is executed for PRs as well as upstream branches (master, 9.0.x, 8.2.x). There is no need to run this check for upstream branches, since all the necessary validation happens at PR stage. Note: all other lint checks (like formatting) should still be executed in upstream branches.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Do not run "validate-commit-message" lint check for upstream branches" (#35020)

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): ensure `DebugNode`/`DebugElement` are tree-shakeable in Ivy
Issues.Body:
There are different `DebugNode`/`DebugElement` implementations (and associated helper functions) for ViewEngine and Ivy. Additionally, these classes/functions, which are defined inside the `core` package, are imported by the `platform-browser` package.

Previously, this code was not tree-shaken as expected in Ivy. #30130 partially addressed the issue, but only for the case where `core` and `platform-browser` end up in the same closure after webpack's scope hoisting. In cases where this is not the case, our webpack/terser based tooling is not capable of tree-shaking it.

This commit fixes the problem, by ensuring that the code retained in Ivy mode (due to the cross-package import) does not unnecessarily reference `DebugNode`/`DebugElement`, allowing the code to be tree-shaken away. This results in a 7.6KB reduction in the size of the main angular.io
bundle.

Jira issue: [FW-1802](https://angular-team.atlassian.net/browse/FW-1802)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(ivy): ensure `DebugNode`/`DebugElement` are tree-shakeable in Ivy" (#35003)

Issues.Title: Make Query String Params Available in ngOnInit ActivatedRoute snapshot
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
@angular/router

### Description
I have been completely unable to find issues or Stack Overflow posts about this. Perhaps there's a justification for why the `ActivatedRoute` behaves the way it does now, but in its present state it seems very counter-intuitive.

The `ActivatedRoute` snapshot during `ngOnInit` does not contain query string params that are in the URL. I find this very counter-intuitive, given that they _are_ available at that time.

The issue I have is that I have some logic that might do route redirecting based on app or local/session storage state, and it might fire before the qs param check. I actually need to know when my component loads if I have a certain qs param or not so I can redirect based on that param. The issue is that I want this to occur _before_ any application logic fires which is not going to happen since the only way to get it is to subscribe to the `ActivatedRoute`. QS params fire after the ngOnInit function completes.

Is there a justification for why QS params are not part of the route snapshot? Given that qs params are part of the URL used to get to the current view, I find it (as do many people on Stack Overflow as evidenced by the number of tickets on this topic) counter-intuitive and ergonomically ugly. Having to subscribe async (and therefore out of order for what I need) causes dirty code vs something that I actually need to be sync. I know I can do something like wrap a timeout, but if the QS param isn't set, then I have this observable hanging out and never completing unless I wire up a timeout or something else for the activated route subscription. Overall, I find it confusing, counter-intuitive, and a source of ugly code.

### Describe the solution you'd like
Add the query string params to the `ActivatedRoute.snapshot` _before_ `OnInit` is called, as one might expect them to be.


### Describe alternatives you've considered
My current alternative is to subscribe to the `ActivatedRoute`, and `take(2)` (since the first emission is always an empty object), and then take the 2nd emission. There are two problems in my use case for this:

1) I need this to be synchronous because it creates a race condition with my other `ngOnInit` bootstrap code and there is a chance that another redirect that _shouldn't_ happen could happen first given my app state.
2) If there are no qs params, `ActivatedRoute` subscription doesn't terminate, which will force me to write an additional arbitrary timeout just to get rid of it, or leave it un-terminated. This is not ideal.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Make Query String Params Available in ngOnInit ActivatedRoute snapshot" (#35018)

Issues.Title: Going back/forward multiple steps doesn't reload components sometimes
Issues.Body:
1. Go to the "Tour of Heroes" app.  I went to the version from the end of the tutorial, here: "https://ybbdbroqogm.angular.stackblitz.io/".  Note you can't go to the "https://stackblitz.com/angular/ybbdbroqogm" version of the app, or you won't be able to do step 4 below.

2. Click "Narco", and note the URL indicates this is for hero ID 12

2. Click "Dashboard"

3. Click "Bombasto" and note the URL indicates this is for hero ID 13

4. Right click on the back button so the history menu comes up and go back 2 steps.  You should see the URL shows hero ID 12, but the details for Bombasto are still shown, and that is hero ID 13.

In general, going forward and back between the Narco and Bombasto pages is broken if you skip over the Dashboard page in between in the history.  If you move by single steps everything works.  Tested in Firefox, Chrome, and Edge.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Going back/forward multiple steps doesn't reload components sometimes" (#35016)

Issues.Title: ci(docs-infra): ignore node version in `aio_monitoring_stable` CI job
Issues.Body:
In #34955, we switched to Node.js v12 on master and 9.0.x. This causes the `aio_monitoring_job` CI job (which checks out files from the stable branch; currently 8.2.x) to start failing yarn's engines check (since the 8.2.x branch expects Node.js version <11).
Example failure: https://circleci.com/gh/angular/angular/602499

Since the job is expected to run with files from both the stable and the master branches (and since the version of Node.js is not important here), this commit uses the `--ignore-engines` option to prevent failures due to Node.js version mismatch.

NOTE:
Typically, the stable and master branch are on the same Node.js version, because related PRs land on both master and the patch branch. One exception is during RC periods, when the stable branch is different than the patch branch. These periods are usually short, but in the case of 9.0.0 the period has lasted several months causing the CI environments between master and the stable branch to get significantly out-of-sync.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "ci(docs-infra): ignore node version in `aio_monitoring_stable` CI job" (#35006)

Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages the are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: --> This feature request is for @angular/compiler-cli


### Description
I am running multiple webpack build pipelines simultaneously  in CI. It does work without Ivy, but with Ivy (Angular 9 rc 11) it fails with:
```
(If you are sure no ngcc process is running then you should delete the lockfile at /drone/src/github.com/Rush/angular-app/node_modules/@angular/compiler-cli/ngcc/__ngcc_lock_file__.)
```

### Describe the solution you'd like
This line should allow overwriting the lock file location:
https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/d15cf60c4969c4da081d0efdbc818abfd3fe43eb/packages/compiler-cli/ngcc/src/execution/lock_file.ts#L20
Perhaps like so:
```
 lockFilePath = process.env.ANGULAR_NGCC_LOCK_FILE_PATH || 
      this.fs.resolve(require.resolve('@angular/compiler-cli/ngcc'), '../__ngcc_lock_file__');
```

I think this is safe cause all simultaneous compiles are happening in Webpack so they're not conflicting with each other. @petebacondarwin @AndrewKushnir 

Not having this would cause my builds running 10x more slowly due to a lot of parallelism.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
Disabling the lock file with a config option.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Allow specifying custom NGCC lockfile location (cannot build in parallel with Ivy)" (#35000)

# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
This feature request is for @angular/forms


### Description
The only way to set a FormControl's updateOn property is in the constructor. In my case I'm writing an app and a library of controls for myself and my team to use. We have a set of custom validators that all are supposed to work with `updateOn: 'blur'` and so in my BaseValidator (which all validators extend) I want to force `updateOn: 'blur'`. However, the FormControl is defined in the app that consumes the BaseValidator.

### Describe the solution you'd like
```
const fc = new FormControl('');
fc.setUpdateMethod('blur');
```

### Describe alternatives you've considered
I've tried to work around the issue by using setControl but to no avail.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "FormControls updateOn property should be able to set" (#35005)

Issues.Title: Animations metadata is not inherited to sub-classed components
Issues.Body:
In Ivy, the `@Component({...})` metadata is inherited from a parent class. However, it appears that `animations` is not included.

This causes an issue when a parent class component defines animations host bindings and an animations definition, but the subclassed component only receives the host bindings.

The renderer throws an error but it is not helpful:
`Found the synthetic property @state. Please include either "BrowserAnimationsModule" or "NoopAnimationsModule" in your application.`

Reproduction: https://stackblitz.com/edit/ivy-ejv3ha?file=src/app/hello.component.ts
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Animations metadata is not inherited to sub-classed components" (#34999)

Issues.Title: refactor(language-service): make findOutputBinding a utility function
Issues.Body:
This commit makes `findOutputBinding` a utility function for the
language service, which will be used by the `expression_diagnostics`
module in #34570. Keeping the function in `locate_symbol` results in a
circular dependency between `expression_diagnostics` and
`locate_symbol`.

execute the benchmark tests locally rather than on RBE executors.

<details>
<summary>puppeteer/puppeteer</summary>

#### Big changes

-   Chromium 80.0.3987.0 (r722234)
-   The launcher now has an option to run Puppeteer with different browsers, starting with Firefox ([#​5137](https://togithub.com/puppeteer/puppeteer/issues/5137)). This is a first step towards eventually deprecating the separate `puppeteer-firefox` package in favor of supporting Firefox directly in `puppeteer` itself.

Issues.Title: Something changed in fileReplacements and assets with Angular 9
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [x ] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes, the pipeline to build/deploy was working in Angular 8.2, the behaviour changed migrating to Angular 9.rc10 ### Description The way that angular.json configuration for "fileReplacements" and "assets" works has changed. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction To deploy with CloudFoundry I need to provide an environment specific manifest.yml file. So I have a manifest.{env}.yml for each environment. In 8.2, I was specifying to replace the manifest file with "fileReplacements", and then adding the manifest.yml as an "asset" to push to CloudFoundry. For example for the environment "staging" I would have: /src/deployment/manifest.staging.yml /src/deployment/manifest.yml The first step here would be fileReplacements kicking in, moving the content from manifest.staging.yml inside manifest.yml The second/last step is manifest.yml being included in dist through the "assets" configuration, but with the staging's configuration inside. Instead, after migrating to Angular 9.rc10, fileReplacements doesn't happen in time and manifest.yml has the content of the original (non-staging) one. As a possible fix I tried this approach: I tried to change my assets configuration to grab directly the manifest file: { "glob": "manifest.staging.yml", "input": "apps/appointment-manager/src/deployment", "output": "manifest.yml" }, I expected: dist/manifest.yml Instead I got: dist/manifest.yml/manifest.staging.yml the output was read as a directory where to place the content. ## üî• Exception or Error Nope. ## üåç Your Environment 

Angular CLI: 9.0.0-rc.10
Node: 12.4.0
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 9.0.0-rc.10
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, localize, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, router
Ivy Workspace: Yes

Issues.Title: Schematics compliance with no-any lint rule
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request

### Command
- [x] lint

### Description

It's a very good practice in TypeScript to enable the `no-any` TSLint rule, which ensures that no `any` is used, as it's not type safe. Since [TypeScript 3.0](http://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/release-notes/typescript-3-0.html#new-unknown-top-type), when a value type is really not known, the right type is `unknown`, which is type safe.

### Describe the solution you'd like

It would be nice if Angular CLI schematics could be compliant with that lint rule by default. It's currently not the case:
- in `test.ts` configuration files (application and library)
- in pipe schematic
- in e2e boilerplate

That would also be more consistent with other schematics where unknown values are indeed typed as `unknown` (like in the [interceptor schematic](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/master/packages/schematics/angular/interceptor/files/__name%40dasherize%40if-flat__/__name%40dasherize__.interceptor.ts.template)).

PR done in #16771. Note that it does not enable the lint rule, it just makes schematics compliant with it, so it has no consequences at all.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Schematics compliance with no-any lint rule" (#16770)

Issues.Title: Schematics compliance with call-signature lint rule
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request

### Command
- [x] lint

### Description

It's a very good practice in TypeScript to enable the `typedef: ["call-signature"]` TSLint rule, which ensures that functions return type is explicit.

Why?
- because otherwise TypeScript infers the return type, but based on the code, which assumes the code is correct (while it may not);
- it's the minimal documentation that should be expected in any code.

### Describe the solution you'd like

It would be nice if Angular CLI schematics could be compliant with that lint rule by default. It's currently not the case:
- in component schematic `ngOnInit()`
- in e2e schematics

The first one is especially annoying as then we need to add `: void` each time we create a new component.

That would also be more consistent with other schematics where the functions return type is indeed explicit (like guards, interceptors, etc.).

PR done in #16755. Note that it does not enable the lint rule, it just makes schematics compliant with it, so it has no consequences at all.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Schematics compliance with call-signature lint rule" (#16754)

Issues.Title: Angular CLI component generations template for .spec.ts is missing an await
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report

### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are effected by this bug? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->

- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [x] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc


### Is this a regression?
No


### Description
Angular CLI component generations template for `.spec.ts` is missing an `await`.
The code generated looks like this:

```JavaScript
  beforeEach(async(() => {
    TestBed.configureTestingModule({
      declarations: [ MyComponent ]
    })
    .compileComponents();
  }));
```

The anonymous function was made `async` in this issue: https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/4774

But just making the function `async` will not make it wait for the asynchronous call to `compileComponents()`.

The code should be changed to this (added `await`):
```JavaScript
  beforeEach(async(() => {
    await TestBed.configureTestingModule({
      declarations: [ MyComponent ]
    })
    .compileComponents();
  }));
```

Source code: https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/master/packages/schematics/angular/component/files/__name%40dasherize%40if-flat__/__name%40dasherize__.__type%40dasherize__.spec.ts.template


## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction
Simply generate a new component with tests:
```
ng generate component my-component
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Angular CLI component generations template for .spec.ts is missing an await" (#16767)

Issues.Title: ng add --registry not working
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [x] add - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Unsure, probably not. ### Description When trying to install a package with `ng add` from a local npm registry, using `ng add package-name --registry=http://localhost:4873/` (Verdaccio in my case), `ng add` seems to ignore the `--registry` parameter and continues to try and pull the package from the registry url set in npm config. If I set the npm registry to localhost manually, ng add works fine. `npm config set registry http://localhost:4873` Previous issue which asked for this feature: #14189. PR which supposedly added this feature: #14285. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Prerequisites: - Have Verdaccio or any other private / local npm registry running. - Have some package published in the private registry. Steps: 1. Generate new Angular project with `ng new`. 2. Run `ng add package-name --registry=http://localhost:4873`, replace package name and url with your own. 3. It will now throw an error because it can't find the package on `https://registry.npmjs.org/`, obviously. ## üî• Exception or Error

npm ERR! 404 Not Found - GET https://registry.npmjs.org/package-name - Not found

npm ERR! 404 You should bug the author to publish it (or use the name yourself!)

npm ERR! 404 tarball, folder, http url, or git url.

Issues.Title: fix(autocomplete): mark control as touched once panel is closed
Issues.Body:
Currently we mark the autocomplete control as touched on `blur`. The problem is that the `blur` event happens a split second before the panel is closed which can cause the error styling to show up and disappear quickly which looks glitchy. These changes change it so that the control is marked as touched once the panel is closed.

Also makes a couple of underscored properties private since they weren't used anywhere in the view.

Fixes #18313.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(autocomplete): mark control as touched once panel is closed" (#18318)

Issues.Title: Drag and drop - Preview swaping items instead of moving
Issues.Body:
#### What are you trying to do?

Swap items in preview mode instead of moving them.

I got it working on the drop method by using this code
```
 drop(event: CdkDragDrop<string[]>) {
    const temp = this.items[event.currentIndex];
    this.items[event.currentIndex] = this.items[event.previousIndex];
    this.items[event.previousIndex] = temp;
  }
```

But the preview does not work like that, instead it moves the items to the initial dragged item position.

#### What troubleshooting steps have you tried?

I tried disabling sorting, but when I do that, the drop event always set `event.currentIndex` equal to `event.previousIndex`.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
Stackblitz: [https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-15vjqk](https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-15vjqk)

Move items around.
  
#### Environment

- Angular: 8.1.1
- CDK/Material: 8.2.3
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System): Windows 10 Pro X64
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Drag and drop - Preview swaping items instead of moving" (#18317)

Issues.Title: Option to have no tab selected in mat-tab-group
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

Allow MatTabGroup to have a state where no tab is selected/active. The current behavior always has a tab selected/active.

Currently, MatTabGroup has a selectedIndex property with type number | null, but setting it to null does not unselect any of the tabs; the first tab is selected/active by default. I think that it would be more intuitive if setting selectedIndex to null unselected all of the tabs.

#### Use Case

Adding this feature would allow for a tab group to be in a collapsed state where no tab is selected and only the header is visible. Clicking one of the tabs in the header would then set the selected tab, the current behavior. This would provide more flexibility in using tabs for a layout.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Option to have no tab selected in mat-tab-group" (#18316)

Issues.Title: fix(schematics): global typography class always being added
Issues.Body:
In #17602 a new prompt to `ng-add` was added which allowed consumers to opt into adding the `mat-typgoraphy` style globally, but it looks like the option was never read so the class is always being added.

Fixes #16776.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(schematics): global typography class always being added" (#18315)

Issues.Title: fix(material-experimental/mdc-chips): chip removal not working if animations are disabled
Issues.Body:
MDC waits for a `transitionend` event to fire before it emits the chip removal event, but if animations are disabled the event won't fire. These changes switch to using a very short transition instead.

**Note:** setting this to a P2, because it has a high probability of breaking people's tests.

Fixes #18303.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material-experimental/mdc-chips): chip removal not working if animations are disabled" (#18314)

Issues.Title: Mat Autocomplete With Required Input Flashes Error on Option Select
Issues.Body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
If a mat autocomplete has a required input, the input flashes red/invalid briefly upon selecting an item from the autocomplete. This only happens if nothing has been typed in the input field. 

#### What is the expected behavior?
The input should not flash red if an option is in progress of being selected

#### What is the current behavior?
The input briefly shows as red as an option is selected

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
Stackblitz: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-vtjbve

Reproduction Steps:
1. Click the input
2. Click an option


#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?
Can be confusing for end users to see an error flash like that

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Angular: 8.2.13
Material: 8.2.3
OS: win32 x64
TypeScript: 3.5.3
Browsers tested: Chrome Version: 79.0.3945.130

#### Is there anything else we should know?
N/A
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Mat Autocomplete With Required Input Flashes Error on Option Select" (#18313)

Issues.Title: Table with paginator, ExpressionChangedAfterItHasBeenChecked when restoring page index
Issues.Body: #### Reproduction My case is a quite straightforward search result display with paginator. When I navigate away from the search result route from the first result page and come back to it, everything works fine. When I navigate away from another page (index > 0) and come back to it, an `ExpressionChangedAfterIthasBeenChecked` error is raised. Reproduction link : https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-okcqx3 Steps to reproduce: 1. Clic on "item11" or "item22" link, then "back to table". No error is raised 2. Navigate to page 2 or 3 and clic any link ("item33" for instance), then "back to table". Error is raised. Detailed messages (two different errors are raised) : - `Previous value: 'disabled: true'. Current value: 'disabled: false'` - `Previous value: 'null: undefined'. Current value: 'null: 33'` I know the conditions which can lead to `ExpressionChangedAfterIthasBeenChecked` but could not identify any here. I could narrow the condition for the second error : `{{item.name}}` However, I do not understand why my code would trigger a change during the two detection cycles. I cannot figure out why the `*ngIf` at this line of the template would be interpreted once as undefined, then as 33. The id of the item is always present in this 33 item. The name of the property (`null`) is also quite strange. #### Expected Behavior No error raised in browser console. #### Actual Behavior An `ExpressionChangedAfterIthasBeenChecked` Error is raised. Note : This behavior is present only during development phase as the check is removed as expected by the `--prod` compilation. I did NOT see any production problem related to it. However, due to a general ErrorHandler in the application (which is catching all the frontend errors for proper display), the `ExpressionChangedAfterIthasBeenChecked` is rather annoying as it triggers this general handler. #### Environment - Angular: 8.2.14 - CDK/Material: 8.2.3 - Browser(s): Tested on Chrome and Firefox - Operating System : Win 10
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Table with paginator, ExpressionChangedAfterItHasBeenChecked when restoring page index" (#18311)

Issues.Title: Deleting an mdc chip does not work when animations are disabled
Issues.Body:
MDC chip foundation relies on the transition animation for the exit class for processing chip deletion:
https://github.com/material-components/material-components-web/blob/302cfd02ace89acf74c90dd13e0a99afc6112fbc/packages/mdc-chips/chip/foundation.ts#L156

When using `NoopAnimationModule` transitions are disabled via the `_mat-animation-noopable` class:
https://github.com/angular/components/blob/0760454aefd5315ba56d6793c6fcee34c9165e04/src/material-experimental/mdc-chips/chip.ts#L108
https://github.com/angular/components/blob/0760454aefd5315ba56d6793c6fcee34c9165e04/src/material/core/style/_noop-animation.scss#L18

This means that any application using the `NoopAnimationModule` (mostly tests) will not handle chip deletion correctly. This could be solved by having a special class that makes transition durations very short when a transition is required for the component to work correctly.

A harder to solve problem (and one that would need to be solved in MDC foundation itself) may be applications that disable transitions with a global css override like `* { transition: none; }`

One additional note: this issue was observed when using the mdc chips with Angular Ivy enabled. For some reason, the `_mat-animation-noopable` class isn't being added to the chip when View Engine is enabled (and I have not investigated why that is).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Deleting an mdc chip does not work when animations are disabled" (#18303)

}

Issues.Title: feat: Focus indicators
Issues.Body:
This PR adds two CSS mixins that add strong focus styles (i.e. focus indicators) to all Material and MDC components.
- `mat-strong-focus-indicators`: Mixin that adds strong focus styles to all Material components.
- `mat-mdc-strong-focus-indicators`: Mixin that adds strong focus styles to all (currently implemented) MDC components.

Notes:
- Should we squash/amend these commits before merging to follow the commit message guidelines? If so, I'm not sure I can do this as an outside contributor.
- A few of these commits are authored by 4220717+zelliott@users.noreply.github.com instead of zell@google.com... causing CLA to fail. Again, I don't think I can edit the commit author emails as a contributor.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat: Focus indicators" (#18299)

Issues.Title: mat-slider: disable special styling on minimum value
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

If a `<mat-slider>` is set to its minimum value, it adds a special class (`.mat-slider-min-value`) that changes the styling of the slider thumb. It would be useful to disable this behavior or adjust the value where this "resting state" occurs.

#### Use Case

In our scenario, the slider ranges from negative to positive values, so the minimum value is not semantically different to other values (except maybe the zero position). It would be nice to visually represent this equality.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "mat-slider: disable special styling on minimum value" (#18298)

Issues.Title: fix(drag-drop): auto scrolling not working if list uses scroll snapping
Issues.Body:
When scrolling a drop list we increment `scrollTop` or `scrollLeft`, but if the list has scroll snapping the browser will only scroll it according to the snap points. These changes reset the scroll snapping while the user is dragging.

Fixes #18162.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(drag-drop): auto scrolling not working if list uses scroll snapping" (#18294)

Issues.Title: mat-icon font causing an overflow
Issues.Body: #### Reproduction https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-e2qgob?file=src%2Fapp%2Ficon-overview-example.html Steps to reproduce: 1. Visit the stackblitz link 2. Notice there is a horizontal scrollbar seemingly caused by nothing After doing some digging, I've found the root issue to be the text "checkmark" in `checkmark` is still taking up space despite text not being rendered. In this screenshot notice the horizontal scrollbar: In this screenshot I've disabled the icon font so we can see that the "checkmark" text is taking up space. #### Potential Fix Setting `.material-icons { overflow: hidden }` is a quick and easy fix for this issue. #### Expected Behavior Icon font shouldn't take up more space than its set `width: 24px`. #### Actual Behavior Icon font is taking up more than the set `width: 24px` of the icon. #### Environment - Angular: 8.2.14 - CDK/Material: 8.2.14 - Browser(s): Firefox, Safari, Chrome - Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "mat-icon font causing an overflow" (#18295)
